[Angel's Grace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel's Grace), anybody?
  
   
EDIT
  
   
I think this card is one of the more perfect cards in MTG.
  
It's a real game finisher while it's on the board, and an immediate threat,
  
And there's so many ways to abuse this card, on both sides of the table.
  
It's quite tricky, and imaginitive.
  
I love this card.

posts.post_content: Want to have fun? Run Phage as your EDH general in a casual match. As long as you have access to [Platinum Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Platinum Angel), she's a truly frightening commander -- all you need is a protection/counter suite ([Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves), [Swiftfoot Boots](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swiftfoot Boots), [Darksteel Plate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Plate), [Nether World](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nether World), [Thrull Wizard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrull Wizard), etc.) and a tutor/reanimation suite for the Angel.
posts.html:
Want to have fun? Run Phage as your EDH general in a casual match. As long as you have access to Platinum Angel, she's a truly frightening commander -- all you need is a protection/counter suite (Lightning Greaves, Swiftfoot Boots, Darksteel Plate, Nether World, Thrull Wizard, etc.) and a tutor/reanimation suite for the Angel.

posts.post_content:
The most fun thing to do with Phage is imprint her on a [Summoner's Egg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Summoner's Egg) or [Clone Shell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone Shell). Give the card to your opponent somehow ([Bazaar Trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bazaar Trader), [Legerdemain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Legerdemain) -- whatever). Then simply kill the Shell / Egg.
  
   
It's roughly as fun AND reliable as playing your state lottery.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I was just reading the story about her. Apparently, she used to be a barbarian named [Jeska, Warrior Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jeska, Warrior Adept). She was then captured by [Braids, Cabal Minion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braids, Cabal Minion), and turned into Phage by the [Cabal Patriarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Patriarch). Cursed to rot anything she touched, she could only wear clothes made of silk, and touch inorganic materials. However, the Patriarch could touch her, because he shared a similar curse, and they actually had a child. The child was the reincarnation of some sort of god that had been hanging out with the Cabal.  
  
Eventually, [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) came to kill Phage (that was actually the purpose behind Akroma being created - she was created by an illusionist and is technically an ILLUSION angel), and the Patriarch killed her, but accidentally killed Phage and their child in the same swing, causing a new god to be born somehow (part of it was Phage's planeswalker spark) - called [Karona, False God/auto](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karona, False God/auto)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I was just reading the story about her. Apparently, she used to be a barbarian named Jeska, Warrior Adept. She was then captured by Braids, Cabal Minion, and turned into Phage by the Cabal Patriarch. Cursed to rot anything she touched, she could only wear clothes made of silk, and touch inorganic materials. However, the Patriarch could touch her, because he shared a similar curse, and they actually had a child. The child was the reincarnation of some sort of god that had been hanging out with the Cabal.

Eventually, Akroma, Angel of Wrath came to kill Phage (that was actually the purpose behind Akroma being created - she was created by an illusionist and is technically an ILLUSION angel), and the Patriarch killed her, but accidentally killed Phage and their child in the same swing, causing a new god to be born somehow (part of it was Phage's planeswalker spark) - called Karona, False God/auto... posts.post_content:
Her house's doors lead [to Nothingness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=to Nothingness).  
  
She owns a [Lich's Mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lich's Mirror).  
  
One of her best friends is a [persecutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=persecutor) of the abyss.  
  
She also tried to commit to a [Warrior's Oath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warrior's Oath) as her [Last Chance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Last Chance) at a [Final Fortune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Final Fortune).  
  
  
Erm.... her father was a [Lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lich)??? A [Nefarious](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nefarious) one, sometimes?   
Ok, that's too much...
